<extra_id_0> Interferon-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) modulates the expression of several cytokines by human monocytes at the transcriptional level .
In view of these findings , we analyzed the effects of <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on the expression of different transcription factors in activated human monocytes .

Priming of human monocytes with <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> resulted in the down regulation of <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA in response to stimulation with lipopolysaccharide ( LPS ) compared to the effects of LPS alone .

text: Not only was this effect observed at the mRNA level , but activator protein - 1 ( AP-1 ) DNA binding capacity was affected as well , A strong reduction was observed in the LPS - induced DNA - binding activity of AP-1 in the presence of <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

LPS - stimulated monocytes showed an increased expression of <extra_id_0> p105 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA , the precursor of the <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> subunit of the transcription factor nuclear factor-kappa B ( NF-kappa B ) , while no effect was noticed on the expression of <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA .

Electrophoretic mobility shift assays ( EMSAs ) demonstrated that unstimulated monocytes predominantly expressed <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> NF-kappa B . text: We conclude that the effects of <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on the expression of the transcription factors AP-1 and NF-kappa B may be important for the modulatory effects of <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on the cytokine expression in activated human monocytes .
